data.text:
@JacobRAdkins @GregProops @Reuters But just because I feel bad.  Here is just one study you can read (hopefully).

https://t.co/DOAofzNXZJ
@JacobRAdkins @GregProops @Reuters Numbers don't belong to people.  Just look it up.  I'm not here to tell you what to believe.  I'm not *your* cable news channel.  Look it up your self.
@pjones54327 @GregProops @Reuters And where are you getting *your* numbers?

@JacobRAdkins @GregProops @Reuters Statistics on how dangerous covid is to children vs. the vaccine efficacy for children.  The numbers don't line up.  You don't need to be a "medical professional" to understand basic statistics.
@pjones54327 @GregProops @Reuters What does “basic math” have to do with anything?
@JacobRAdkins @GregProops @Reuters No I just understand basic math.
@TKNO13 @hazard731 @Reuters Then why is it the most migrated to state while California is losing the most population?  Hmm.

@JacobRAdkins @dteller1221 @Kaitlin17281735 @Reuters Yes it does differ from mine. I believe the relationship between doctor and patient is not for politicians to interfere in. I also think politicizing a virus is insane and makes it hard to get to the truth. I stand by this.
@pjones54327 @hazard731 @Reuters I think that‘s more due to weather and climate than to state‘s policies.
